description: Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) synthetic data template. An RRSP is a registered savings account in Canada that offers tax benefits and helps individuals save for retirement. This template includes fields for account holder details, contribution limits, tax benefits, borrowing options for home buying and education, and post-retirement options.

RRSP_ID.description: Unique identifier for the RRSP account.

AccountHolderName.description: Full name of the RRSP account holder.

AccountHolderDOB.description: Date of birth of the account holder.

ContributionLimit.description: Annual maximum contribution limit for the RRSP (e.g., $31,560 for 2024).

UnusedDeductionRoom.description: Unused RRSP deduction room carried forward from previous years.

HomeBuyersPlanAmount.description: Amount borrowed under the Home Buyers' Plan (up to a maximum of $60,000).

LifelongLearningPlanAmount.description: Amount borrowed per calendar year under the Lifelong Learning Plan (up to $10,000 per year, with a lifetime maximum of $20,000).

TotalBalance.description: Current total balance of the RRSP account.

AccountCreationDate.description: Date when the RRSP account was established.

AgeAtContributionStop.description: Age at which contributions to the RRSP stop (typically 71).

PostRetirementOption.description: The option selected at or after age 71: convert to a Registered Retirement Income Fund (RRIF), purchase an annuity, or opt for withdrawal.

Investments.description: List of investment types held within the RRSP.
